Text: AMENDMENT OF 1986 CODE. Text: SPECIAL RULES FOR DETERMINING APPLICABLE CORPORATION STATUS.
Keywords: special, rules, determining, applicable, corporation, status

Text: IN GENERAL. Solely for purposes of determining whether a corporation is an applicable corporation under this paragraph, all adjusted financial statement income of persons treated as a single employer with such corporation under subsection (a) or (b) of section 52 (determined with the modifications described in clause (ii)) shall be treated as adjusted financial statement income of such corporation, and adjusted financial statement income of such corporation shall be determined without regard to paragraphs (2)(D)(i) and (11) of section 56A(c).
Keywords: solely, purposes, determining, corporation, applicable, adjusted, financial, statement, income, persons, treated, employer, subsection, determined, modifications, described, clause, regard, paragraphs, 56a

Text: MODIFICATIONS. For purposes of this subparagraph
Keywords: modifications, purposes, subparagraph

Keywords: applied, substituting, component, members

Text: for purposes of applying section 52(b), the term ‘trade or business’ shall include any activity treated as a trade or business under paragraph (5) or (6) of section 469(c) (determined without regard to the phrase ‘To the extent provided in regulations’ in such paragraph (6)).
Keywords: purposes, applying, term, trade, business, activity, treated, determined, regard, phrase, extent, regulations

Text: COMPONENT MEMBER. For purposes of this subparagraph, the term ‘component member’ has the meaning given such term by section 1563(b), except that the determination shall be made without regard to section 1563(b)(2).

Text: OTHER SPECIAL RULES.
Keywords: special, rules

Text: CORPORATIONS IN EXISTENCE FOR LESS THAN 3 YEARS. If the corporation was in existence for less than 3-taxable years, subparagraph (B) shall be applied on the basis of the period during which such corporation was in existence.
Keywords: corporations, existence, years, corporation, taxable, subparagraph, applied, basis, period

Text: SHORT TAXABLE YEARS. Adjusted financial statement income for any taxable year of less than 12 months shall be annualized by multiplying the adjusted financial statement income for the short period by 12 and dividing the result by the number of months in the short period.
Keywords: taxable, years, adjusted, financial, statement, income, months, annualized, multiplying, period, dividing, number

Text: TREATMENT OF PREDECESSORS. Any reference in this subparagraph to a corporation shall include a reference to any predecessor of such corporation.
Keywords: treatment, predecessors, reference, subparagraph, corporation, predecessor

Text: SPECIAL RULE FOR FOREIGN-PARENTED MULTINATIONAL GROUPS.
Keywords: special, rule, foreign, parented, multinational

Text: IN GENERAL. If a corporation is a member of a foreign-parented multinational group for any taxable year, then, solely for purposes of determining whether such corporation meets the average annual adjusted financial statement income test under paragraph (1)(B)(ii)(I) for such taxable year, the adjusted financial statement income of such corporation for such taxable year shall include the adjusted financial statement income of all members of such group. Solely for purposes of this subparagraph, adjusted financial statement income shall be determined without regard to paragraphs (2)(D)(i), (3), (4), and (11) of section 56A(c).
Keywords: corporation, member, foreign, parented, multinational, group, taxable, solely, purposes, determining, meets, average, annual, adjusted, financial, statement, income, test

Text: FOREIGN-PARENTED MULTINATIONAL GROUP. For purposes of subparagraph (A), the term ‘foreign-parented multinational group’ means, with respect to any taxable year, two or more entities if
Keywords: foreign, parented, multinational, group, purposes, subparagraph, term, respect, taxable, entities

Keywords: entities, included, applicable, financial, statement, respect

the common parent of such entities is a foreign corporation, or
Keywords: parent, entities, foreign, corporation

Text: FOREIGN CORPORATIONS ENGAGED IN A TRADE OR BUSINESS WITHIN THE UNITED STATES. For purposes of this paragraph, if a foreign corporation is engaged in a trade or business within the United States, such trade or business shall be treated as a separate domestic corporation that is wholly owned by the foreign corporation.
Keywords: foreign, corporations, engaged, trade, business, united, states, purposes, corporation, treated, separate, domestic, wholly, owned

Keywords: rules, secretary, applying, principles, prescribe, application, determination

Keywords: entities, included, foreign, parented, multinational, group

Text: ADJUSTED FINANCIAL STATEMENT INCOME.
Keywords: adjusted, financial, statement, income

Text: IN GENERAL. Part VI of subchapter A of chapter 1 is amended by inserting after section 56 the following new section:
Keywords: vi, amended, inserting, new

Text: ADJUSTED FINANCIAL STATEMENT INCOME.
Keywords: adjusted, financial, statement, income

Text: IN GENERAL. For purposes of this part, the term ‘adjusted financial statement income’ means, with respect to any corporation for any taxable year, the net income or loss of the taxpayer set forth on the taxpayer’s applicable financial statement for such taxable year, adjusted as provided in this section.
Keywords: purposes, term, adjusted, financial, statement, income, respect, corporation, taxable, loss, taxpayer, forth, taxpayer’s, applicable

Text: APPLICABLE FINANCIAL STATEMENT. For purposes of this section, the term ‘applicable financial statement’ means, with respect to any taxable year, an applicable financial statement (as defined in section 451(b)(3) or as specified by the Secretary in regulations or other guidance) which covers such taxable year.
Keywords: applicable, financial, statement, purposes, term, respect, taxable, defined, specified, secretary, regulations, guidance, covers

Text: GENERAL ADJUSTMENTS.
Keywords: adjustments

Text: STATEMENTS COVERING DIFFERENT TAXABLE YEARS. Appropriate adjustments shall be made in adjusted financial statement income in any case in which an applicable financial statement covers a period other than the taxable year.
Keywords: statements, covering, taxable, years, appropriate, adjustments, adjusted, financial, statement, income, case, applicable, covers, period

Text: SPECIAL RULES FOR RELATED ENTITIES.
Keywords: special, rules, related, entities

Text: CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. If the financial results of a taxpayer are reported on the applicable financial statement for a group of entities, rules similar to the rules of section 451(b)(5) shall apply.
Keywords: consolidated, financial, statements, results, taxpayer, reported, applicable, statement, group, entities, rules, apply

Text: CONSOLIDATED RETURNS. Except as provided in regulations prescribed by the Secretary, if the taxpayer is part of an affiliated group of corporations filing a consolidated return for any taxable year, adjusted financial statement income for such group for such taxable year shall take into account items on the group’s applicable financial statement which are properly allocable to members of such group.
Keywords: consolidated, returns, except, regulations, prescribed, secretary, taxpayer, affiliated, group, corporations, filing, return, taxable, adjusted, financial, statement, income, account, group’s, applicable, properly, allocable, members

Text: TREATMENT OF DIVIDENDS AND OTHER AMOUNTS. In the case of any corporation which is not included on a consolidated return with the taxpayer, adjusted financial statement income of the taxpayer with respect to such other corporation shall be determined by only taking into account the dividends received from such other corporation (reduced to the extent provided by the Secretary in regulations or other guidance) and other amounts which are includible in gross income or deductible as a loss under this chapter (other than amounts required to be included under sections 951 and 951A or such other amounts as provided by the Secretary) with respect to such other corporation.
Keywords: treatment, dividends, amounts, case, corporation, included, consolidated, return, taxpayer, adjusted, financial, statement, income, respect, determined, taking, account, reduced, extent, secretary, regulations, guidance, includible, gross, deductible, loss, required, sections, 951a

Text: TREATMENT OF PARTNERSHIPS.
Keywords: treatment, partnerships

Text: IN GENERAL. Except as provided by the Secretary, if the taxpayer is a partner in a partnership, adjusted financial statement income of the taxpayer with respect to such partnership shall be adjusted to only take into account the taxpayer’s distributive share of adjusted financial statement income of such partnership.
Keywords: except, secretary, taxpayer, partner, partnership, adjusted, financial, statement, income, respect, account, taxpayer’s, distributive

Text: ADJUSTED FINANCIAL STATEMENT INCOME OF PARTNERSHIPS. For the purposes of this part, the adjusted financial statement income of a partnership shall be the partnership’s net income or loss set forth on such partnership’s applicable financial statement (adjusted under rules similar to the rules of this section).
Keywords: adjusted, financial, statement, income, partnerships, purposes, partnership, partnership’s, loss, forth, applicable, rules

Text: ADJUSTMENTS TO TAKE INTO ACCOUNT CERTAIN ITEMS OF FOREIGN INCOME.
Keywords: adjustments, account, certain, foreign, income

Text: IN GENERAL. If, for any taxable year, a taxpayer is a United States shareholder of one or more controlled foreign corporations, the adjusted financial statement income of such taxpayer with respect to such controlled foreign corporation (as determined under paragraph (2)(C)) shall be adjusted to also take into account such taxpayer’s pro rata share (determined under rules similar to the rules under section 951(a)(2)) of items taken into account in computing the net income or loss set forth on the applicable financial statement (as adjusted under rules similar to those that apply in determining adjusted financial statement income) of each such controlled foreign corporation with respect to which such taxpayer is a United States shareholder.
Keywords: taxable, taxpayer, united, states, shareholder, controlled, foreign, corporations, adjusted, financial, statement, income, respect, corporation, determined

Text: NEGATIVE ADJUSTMENTS. In any case in which the adjustment determined under subparagraph (A) would result in a negative adjustment for such taxable year
Keywords: negative, adjustments, case, adjustment, determined, subparagraph, taxable

Text: no adjustment shall be made under this paragraph for such taxable year, and
Keywords: adjustment, taxable

Text: the amount of the adjustment determined under this paragraph for the succeeding taxable year (determined without regard to this paragraph) shall be reduced by an amount equal to the negative adjustment for such taxable year.
Keywords: amount, adjustment, determined, succeeding, taxable, regard, reduced, equal, negative

Text: EFFECTIVELY CONNECTED INCOME. In the case of a foreign corporation, to determine adjusted financial statement income, the principles of section 882 shall apply.
Keywords: effectively, connected, income, case, foreign, corporation, determine, adjusted, financial, statement, principles, apply

Text: ADJUSTMENTS FOR CERTAIN TAXES. Adjusted financial statement income shall be appropriately adjusted to disregard any Federal income taxes, or income, war profits, or excess profits taxes (within the meaning of section 901) with respect to a foreign country or possession of the United States, which are taken into account on the taxpayer’s applicable financial statement. To the extent provided by the Secretary, the preceding sentence shall not apply to income, war profits, or excess profits taxes (within the meaning of section 901) that are imposed by a foreign country or possession of the United States and taken into account on the taxpayer’s applicable financial statement if the taxpayer does not choose to have the benefits of subpart A of part III of subchapter N for the taxable year. The Secretary shall prescribe such regulations or other guidance as may be necessary and appropriate to provide for the proper treatment of current and deferred taxes for purposes of this paragraph, including the time at which such taxes are properly taken into account.
Keywords: adjustments, certain, taxes, adjusted, financial, statement, income, appropriately, disregard, federal, profits, excess, meaning, respect, foreign, country, possession, united, states, account, taxpayer’s, applicable, extent, secretary, preceding, sentence, apply, imposed, taxpayer, benefits, subpart, iii, taxable, prescribe, regulations, guidance, necessary, appropriate, proper, treatment, deferred, purposes, properly

Text: ADJUSTMENT WITH RESPECT TO DISREGARDED ENTITIES. Adjusted financial statement income shall be adjusted to take into account any adjusted financial statement income of a disregarded entity owned by the taxpayer.
Keywords: adjustment, respect, disregarded, entities, adjusted, financial, statement, income, account, entity, owned, taxpayer

Text: SPECIAL RULE FOR COOPERATIVES. In the case of a cooperative to which section 1381 applies, the adjusted financial statement income (determined without regard to this paragraph) shall be reduced by the amounts referred to in section 1382(b) (relating to patronage dividends and per-unit retain allocations) to the extent such amounts were not otherwise taken into account in determining adjusted financial statement income.
Keywords: special, rule, cooperatives, case, cooperative, applies, adjusted, financial, statement, income, determined, regard, reduced, amounts, referred, relating, patronage, dividends, unit, retain, allocations, extent, otherwise, account, determining

Keywords: rules, alaska, native, corporations, adjusted, financial, statement, income, appropriately, allow

Keywords: cost, recovery, depletion, attributable, property, basis, determined, alaska, native, claims, settlement, act, u.s.c

Text: deductions for amounts payable made pursuant to section 7(i) or section 7(j) of such Act (43 U.S.C. 1606(i) and 1606(j)) only at such time as the deductions are allowed for tax purposes.

Text: AMOUNTS ATTRIBUTABLE TO ELECTIONS FOR DIRECT PAYMENT OF CERTAIN CREDITS. Adjusted financial statement income shall be appropriately adjusted to disregard any amount treated as a payment against the tax imposed by subtitle A pursuant to an election under section 48D(d) or 6417, to the extent such amount was not otherwise taken into account under paragraph (5).

Text: FINANCIAL STATEMENT NET OPERATING LOSS CARRYOVER. A financial statement net operating loss for any taxable year shall be a financial statement net operating loss carryover to each taxable year following the taxable year of the loss. The portion of such loss which shall be carried to subsequent taxable years shall be the amount of such loss remaining (if any) after the application of paragraph (1).

Text: IN GENERAL. Text: ADJUSTMENT. The amount taken into account under subsection (a) with respect to any stock repurchased by a covered corporation shall be reduced by the fair market value of any stock issued by the covered corporation during the taxable year, including the fair market value of any stock issued or provided to employees of such covered corporation or employees of a specified affiliate of such covered corporation during the taxable year, whether or not such stock is issued or provided in response to the exercise of an option to purchase such stock.

Text: ENFORCEMENT. Text: TASK FORCE TO DESIGN AN IRS-RUN FREE ‘‘DIRECT EFILE’’ TAX RETURN SYSTEM. For necessary expenses of the Internal Revenue Service to deliver to Congress, within nine months following the date of the enactment of this Act, a report on (I) the cost (including options for differential coverage based on taxpayer adjusted gross income and return complexity) of developing and running a free direct efile tax return system, including costs to build and administer each release, with a focus on multi-lingual and mobile-friendly features and safeguards for taxpayer data; (II) taxpayer opinions, expectations, and level of trust, based on surveys, for such a free direct efile system; and (III) the opinions of an independent third-party on the overall feasibility, approach, schedule, cost, organizational design, and Internal Revenue Service capacity to deliver such a direct efile tax return system, $15,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2023: Provided, That these amounts shall be in addition to amounts otherwise available for such purposes.

Text: MAXIMUM FAIR PRICE. Text: TOTAL EXPENDITURES. The term ‘total expenditures’ includes, in the case of expenditures with respect to part D of title XVIII, the total gross covered prescription drug costs (as defined in section 1860D– 15(b)(3)). Keywords: renegotiate, accordance, process, specified, pursuant, subsection, maximum, fair, price, drug, purpose, described, renegotiation, eligible

Text: NEGOTIATION PROCESS REQUIREMENTS.
Keywords: negotiation, process, requirements

Text: METHODOLOGY AND PROCESS. The Secretary shall develop and use a consistent methodology and process, in accordance with paragraph (2), for negotiations under subsection (a) that aims to achieve the lowest maximum fair price for each selected drug.
Keywords: methodology, process, secretary, develop, consistent, accordance, negotiations, subsection, aims, achieve, lowest, maximum, fair, price, selected, drug

Text: SPECIFIC ELEMENTS OF NEGOTIATION PROCESS. As part of the negotiation process under this section, with respect to a selected drug and the negotiation period with respect to the initial price applicability year with respect to such drug, the following shall apply:
Keywords: elements, negotiation, process, respect, selected, drug, period, initial, price, applicability, apply

Text: SUBMISSION OF INFORMATION. Not later than March 1 of the year of the selected drug publication date, with respect to the selected drug, the manufacturer of the drug shall submit to the Secretary, in accordance with section 1193(a)(4), the information described in such section.
Keywords: submission, information, march, selected, drug, publication, respect, manufacturer, submit, secretary, accordance, described

Text: INITIAL OFFER BY SECRETARY. Not later than the June 1 following the selected drug publication date, the Secretary shall provide the manufacturer of the selected drug with a written initial offer that contains the Secretary’s proposal for the maximum fair price of the drug and a concise justification based on the factors described in section 1194(e) that were used in developing such offer.
Keywords: initial, secretary, june, selected, drug, publication, manufacturer, contains, secretary’s, proposal, maximum, fair, price, concise, justification, factors, described, developing

Text: RESPONSE TO INITIAL OFFER.
Keywords: response, initial

Text: IN GENERAL. Not later than 30 days after the date of receipt of an initial offer under subparagraph (B), the manufacturer shall either accept such offer or propose a counteroffer to such offer.
Keywords: receipt, initial, subparagraph, manufacturer, accept, propose, counteroffer

Text: COUNTEROFFER REQUIREMENTS. If a manufacturer proposes a counteroffer, such counteroffer
Keywords: counteroffer, requirements, manufacturer, proposes

Text: shall be in writing; and
Keywords: writing

Text: shall be justified based on the factors described in subsection (e).
Keywords: justified, factors, described, subsection

Text: RESPONSE TO COUNTEROFFER. After receiving a counteroffer under subparagraph (C), the Secretary shall respond in writing to such counteroffer.
Keywords: response, counteroffer, receiving, subparagraph, secretary, respond, writing

Text: DEADLINE. All negotiations between the Secretary and the manufacturer of the selected drug shall end prior to the first day of November following the selected drug publication date, with respect to the initial price applicability year.
Keywords: deadline, negotiations, secretary, manufacturer, selected, drug, prior, november, publication, respect, initial, price, applicability

Text: LIMITATIONS ON OFFER AMOUNT. In negotiating the maximum fair price of a selected drug, with respect to the initial price applicability year for the selected drug, and, as applicable, in renegotiating the maximum fair price for such drug, with respect to a subsequent year during the price applicability period for such drug, the Secretary shall not offer (or agree to a counteroffer for) a maximum fair price for the selected drug that
Keywords: limitations, amount, negotiating, maximum, fair, price, selected, drug, respect, initial, applicability, applicable, renegotiating, subsequent, period, secretary, agree, counteroffer

Text: exceeds the ceiling determined under subsection (c) for the selected drug and year; or
Keywords: exceeds, ceiling, determined, subsection, selected, drug

Text: as applicable, is less than the floor determined under subsection (d) for the selected drug and year.
Keywords: applicable, floor, determined, subsection, selected, drug

Text: CEILING FOR MAXIMUM FAIR PRICE.
Keywords: ceiling, maximum, fair, price

Text: GENERAL CEILING.
Keywords: ceiling

Text: IN GENERAL. The maximum fair price negotiated under this section for a selected drug, with respect to the first initial price applicability year of the price applicability period with respect to such drug, shall not exceed the lower of the amount under subparagraph (B) or the amount under subparagraph (C).
Keywords: maximum, fair, price, negotiated, selected, drug, respect, initial, applicability, period, exceed, lower, amount, subparagraph

Text: SUBPARAGRAPH (B) AMOUNT. An amount equal to the following:
Keywords: subparagraph, amount, equal

Text: COVERED PART D DRUG. In the case of a covered part D drug (as defined in section 1860D–2(e)), the sum of the plan specific enrollment weighted amounts for each prescription drug plan or MA–PD plan (as determined under paragraph (2)).
Keywords: covered, drug, case, defined, 1860d, sum, plan, enrollment, weighted, amounts, prescription, ma, pd, determined

Text: PART B DRUG OR BIOLOGICAL. In the case of a drug or biological product for which payment may be made under part B of title XVIII, the payment amount under section 1847A(b)(4) for the drug or biological product for the year prior to the year of the selected drug publication date with respect to the initial price applicability year for the drug or biological product.
Keywords: drug, biological, case, product, payment, xviii, amount, 1847a, prior, selected, publication, respect, initial, price, applicability

Text: SUBPARAGRAPH (C) AMOUNT. An amount equal to the applicable percent described in paragraph (3), with respect to such drug, of the following:
Keywords: subparagraph, amount, equal, applicable, described, respect, drug

Text: INITIAL PRICE APPLICABILITY YEAR 2026. In the case of a selected drug with respect to which such initial price applicability year is 2026, the average nonFederal average manufacturer price for such drug for 2021 (or, in the case that there is not an average non-Federal average manufacturer price available for such drug for 2021, for the first full year following the market entry for such drug), increased by the percentage increase in the consumer price index for all urban consumers (all items; United States city average) from September 2021 (or December of such first full year following the market entry), as applicable, to September of the year prior to the year of the selected drug publication date with respect to such initial price applicability year.
Keywords: initial, price, applicability, case, selected, drug, respect, average, nonfederal, manufacturer, federal, available, market, increased, percentage, increase, consumer, index, urban, consumers, united, states, city, september, december, applicable, prior, publication

Text: INITIAL PRICE APPLICABILITY YEAR 2027 AND SUBSEQUENT YEARS. In the case of a selected drug with respect to which such initial price applicability year is 2027 or a subsequent year, the lower of
Keywords: initial, price, applicability, subsequent, years, case, selected, drug, respect, lower

Text: the average non-Federal average manufacturer price for such drug for 2021 (or, in the case that there is not an average non-Federal average manufacturer price available for such drug for 2021, for the first full year following the market entry for such drug), increased by the percentage increase in the consumer price index for all urban consumers (all items; United States city average) from September 2021 (or December of such first full year following the market entry), as applicable, to September of the year prior to the year of the selected drug publication date with respect to such initial price applicability year; or
Keywords: average, federal, manufacturer, price, drug, case, available, market, increased, percentage, increase, consumer, index, urban, consumers, united, states, city, september, december, applicable, prior, selected, publication, respect, initial, applicability

Text: the average non-Federal average manufacturer price for such drug for the year prior to the selected drug publication date with respect to such initial price applicability year.
Keywords: average, federal, manufacturer, price, drug, prior, selected, publication, respect, initial, applicability

Text: PLAN SPECIFIC ENROLLMENT WEIGHTED AMOUNT. For purposes of paragraph (1)(B)(i), the plan specific enrollment weighted amount for a prescription drug plan or an MA–PD plan with respect to a covered Part D drug is an amount equal to the product of
Keywords: plan, enrollment, weighted, amount, purposes, prescription, drug, ma, pd, respect, covered, equal, product

Text: the negotiated price of the drug under such plan under part D of title XVIII, net of all price concessions received by such plan or pharmacy benefit managers on behalf of such plan, for the most recent year for which data is available; and
Keywords: negotiated, price, drug, plan, xviii, concessions, pharmacy, benefit, managers, behalf, data, available

Text: a fraction
Keywords: fraction

Text: the numerator of which is the total number of individuals enrolled in such plan in such year; and
Keywords: numerator, total, number, individuals, enrolled, plan

Text: the denominator of which is the total number of individuals enrolled in a prescription drug plan or an MA–PD plan in such year.
Keywords: denominator, total, number, individuals, enrolled, prescription, drug, plan, ma, pd

Text: APPLICABLE PERCENT DESCRIBED. For purposes of this subsection, the applicable percent described in this paragraph is the following:
Keywords: applicable, described, purposes, subsection

Text: SHORT-MONOPOLY DRUGS AND VACCINES. With respect to a selected drug (other than an extended-monopoly drug and a long-monopoly drug), 75 percent.
Keywords: monopoly, drugs, vaccines, respect, selected, drug, extended

Text: EXTENDED-MONOPOLY DRUGS. With respect to an extended-monopoly drug, 65 percent.
Keywords: extended, monopoly, drugs, respect, drug

Text: LONG-MONOPOLY DRUGS. With respect to a long-monopoly drug, 40 percent.
Keywords: monopoly, drugs, respect, drug

Text: EXTENDED-MONOPOLY DRUG DEFINED.
Keywords: extended, monopoly, drug, defined

Text: IN GENERAL. In this part, subject to subparagraph (B), the term ‘extended-monopoly drug’ means, with respect to an initial price applicability year, a selected drug for which at least 12 years, but fewer than 16 years, have elapsed since the date of approval of such drug under section 505(c) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act or since the date of licensure of such drug under section 351(a) of the Public Health Service Act, as applicable.
Keywords: subject, subparagraph, term, extended, monopoly, drug, respect, initial, price, applicability, selected, years, fewer, elapsed, approval, federal, food, cosmetic, act, licensure, public, health, service, applicable

Text: EXCLUSIONS. The term ‘extended-monopoly drug’ shall not include any of the following:
Keywords: exclusions, term, extended, monopoly, drug

Text: A vaccine that is licensed under section 351 of the Public Health Service Act and marketed pursuant to such section.
Keywords: vaccine, licensed, public, health, service, act, marketed, pursuant

Text: A selected drug for which a manufacturer had an agreement under this part with the Secretary with respect to an initial price applicability year that is before 2030.
Keywords: selected, drug, manufacturer, agreement, secretary, respect, initial, price, applicability

Text: CLARIFICATION. Nothing in subparagraph (B)(ii) shall limit the transition of a selected drug described in paragraph (3)(A) to a long-monopoly drug if the selected drug meets the definition of a long-monopoly drug.
Keywords: clarification, nothing, subparagraph, limit, transition, selected, drug, described, monopoly, meets, definition

Text: LONG-MONOPOLY DRUG DEFINED.
Keywords: monopoly, drug, defined

Text: IN GENERAL. In this part, subject to subparagraph (B), the term ‘long-monopoly drug’ means, with respect to an initial price applicability year, a selected drug for which at least 16 years have elapsed since the date of approval of such drug under section 505(c) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act or since the date of licensure of such drug under section 351(a) of the Public Health Service Act, as applicable.
Keywords: subject, subparagraph, term, monopoly, drug, respect, initial, price, applicability, selected, years, elapsed, approval, federal, food, cosmetic, act, licensure, public, health, service, applicable

Text: EXCLUSION. The term ‘long-monopoly drug’ shall not include a vaccine that is licensed under section 351 of the Public Health Service Act and marketed pursuant to such section.
Keywords: exclusion, term, monopoly, drug, vaccine, licensed, public, health, service, act, marketed, pursuant

Text: AVERAGE NON-FEDERAL AVERAGE MANUFACTURER PRICE. In this part, the term ‘average non-Federal average manufacturer price’ means the average of the non-Federal average manufacturer price (as defined in section 8126(h)(5) of title 38, United States Code) for the 4 calendar quarters of the year involved.
Keywords: average, federal, manufacturer, price, term, defined, united, states, code, calendar, quarters, involved

Text: TEMPORARY FLOOR FOR SMALL BIOTECH DRUGS. In the case of a selected drug that is a qualifying single source drug described in section 1192(d)(2) and with respect to which the first initial price applicability year of the price applicability period with respect to such drug is 2029 or 2030, the maximum fair price negotiated under this section for such drug for such initial price applicability year may not be less than 66 percent of the average nonFederal average manufacturer price for such drug (as defined in subsection (c)(6)) for 2021 (or, in the case that there is not an average non-Federal average manufacturer price available for such drug for 2021, for the first full year following the market entry for such drug), increased by the percentage increase in the consumer price index for all urban consumers (all items; United States city average) from September 2021 (or December of such first full year following the market entry), as applicable, to September of the year prior to the selected drug publication date with respect to the initial price applicability year.
Keywords: temporary, floor, biotech, drugs, case, selected, drug, qualifying, source, described, respect, initial, price, applicability, period, maximum, fair, negotiated, average, nonfederal, manufacturer, defined, subsection, federal, available, market, increased, percentage, increase, consumer, index, urban, consumers, united, states, city, september, december, applicable, prior, publication

Text: FACTORS. For purposes of negotiating the maximum fair price of a selected drug under this part with the manufacturer of the drug, the Secretary shall consider the following factors, as applicable to the drug, as the basis for determining the offers and counteroffers under subsection (b) for the drug:
Keywords: factors, purposes, negotiating, maximum, fair, price, selected, drug, manufacturer, secretary, consider, applicable, basis, determining, counteroffers, subsection

Text: MANUFACTURER-SPECIFIC DATA. The following data, with respect to such selected drug, as submitted by the manufacturer:
Keywords: manufacturer, data, respect, selected, drug, submitted

Text: Research and development costs of the manufacturer for the drug and the extent to which the manufacturer has recouped research and development costs.
Keywords: research, development, costs, manufacturer, drug, extent, recouped

Text: Current unit costs of production and distribution of the drug.
Keywords: unit, costs, production, distribution, drug

Text: Prior Federal financial support for novel therapeutic discovery and development with respect to the drug.
Keywords: prior, federal, financial, support, novel, therapeutic, discovery, development, respect, drug

Text: Data on pending and approved patent applications, exclusivities recognized by the Food and Drug Administration, and applications and approvals under section 505(c) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act or section 351(a) of the Public Health Service Act for the drug.
Keywords: data, pending, approved, patent, applications, exclusivities, recognized, food, drug, administration, approvals, federal, cosmetic, act, public, health, service

Text: Market data and revenue and sales volume data for the drug in the United States.
Keywords: market, data, revenue, sales, volume, drug, united, states

Text: EVIDENCE ABOUT ALTERNATIVE TREATMENTS. The following evidence, as available, with respect to such selected drug and therapeutic alternatives to such drug:
Keywords: evidence, alternative, treatments, available, respect, selected, drug, therapeutic, alternatives

Text: The extent to which such drug represents a therapeutic advance as compared to existing therapeutic alternatives and the costs of such existing therapeutic alternatives.
Keywords: extent, drug, represents, therapeutic, advance, compared, existing, alternatives, costs

Text: Prescribing information approved by the Food and Drug Administration for such drug and therapeutic alternatives to such drug.
Keywords: prescribing, information, approved, food, drug, administration, therapeutic, alternatives

Text: Comparative effectiveness of such drug and therapeutic alternatives to such drug, taking into consideration the effects of such drug and therapeutic alternatives to such drug on specific populations, such as individuals with disabilities, the elderly, the terminally ill, children, and other patient populations.
Keywords: comparative, effectiveness, drug, therapeutic, alternatives, taking, consideration, effects, populations, individuals, disabilities, elderly, terminally, ill, children, patient

Text: The extent to which such drug and therapeutic alternatives to such drug address unmet medical needs for a condition for which treatment or diagnosis is not addressed adequately by available therapy. In using evidence described in subparagraph (C), the Secretary shall not use evidence from comparative clinical effectiveness research in a manner that treats extending the life of an elderly, disabled, or terminally ill individual as of lower value than extending the life of an individual who is younger, nondisabled, or not terminally ill.
Keywords: extent, drug, therapeutic, alternatives, address, unmet, medical, needs, condition, treatment, diagnosis, addressed, adequately, available, therapy, evidence, described, subparagraph, secretary, comparative, clinical, effectiveness, research, manner, treats, extending, life, elderly, disabled, terminally, ill, individual, lower, value, younger, nondisabled

Text: RENEGOTIATION PROCESS.
Keywords: renegotiation, process

Text: IN GENERAL. In the case of a renegotiation-eligible drug (as defined in paragraph (2)) that is selected under paragraph (3), the Secretary shall provide for a process of renegotiation (for years (beginning with 2028) during the price applicability period, with respect to such drug) of the maximum fair price for such drug consistent with paragraph (4).
Keywords: case, renegotiation, eligible, drug, defined, selected, secretary, process, years, beginning, price, applicability, period, respect, maximum, fair, consistent

Text: RENEGOTIATION-ELIGIBLE DRUG DEFINED. In this section, the term ‘renegotiation-eligible drug’ means a selected drug that is any of the following:
Keywords: renegotiation, eligible, drug, defined, term, selected

Text: ADDITION OF NEW INDICATION. A selected drug for which a new indication is added to the drug.
Keywords: addition, new, indication, selected, drug

Text: CHANGE OF STATUS TO AN EXTENDEDMONOPOLY DRUG. A selected drug that
Keywords: status, extendedmonopoly, drug, selected

Text: is not an extended-monopoly or a long-monopoly drug; and
Keywords: extended, monopoly, drug

Text: for which there is a change in status to that of an extended-monopoly drug.
Keywords: status, extended, monopoly, drug

Text: CHANGE OF STATUS TO A LONG-MONOPOLY DRUG. A selected drug that
Keywords: status, monopoly, drug, selected

Text: is not a long-monopoly drug; and
Keywords: monopoly, drug

Text: for which there is a change in status to that of a long-monopoly drug.
Keywords: status, monopoly, drug

Text: MATERIAL CHANGES. A selected drug for which the Secretary determines there has been a material change of any of the factors described in paragraph (1) or (2) of subsection (e).
Keywords: material, selected, drug, secretary, determines, factors, described, subsection

Text: SELECTION OF DRUGS FOR RENEGOTIATION. For each year (beginning with 2028), the Secretary shall select among renegotiation-eligible drugs for renegotiation as follows:
Keywords: selection, drugs, renegotiation, beginning, secretary, select, eligible, follows

Text: ALL EXTENDED-MONOPOLY NEGOTIATION-ELIGIBLE DRUGS. The Secretary shall select all renegotiation-eligible drugs described in paragraph (2)(B).
Keywords: extended, monopoly, negotiation, eligible, drugs, secretary, select, renegotiation, described

Text: ALL LONG-MONOPOLY NEGOTIATIONELIGIBLE DRUGS. The Secretary shall select all renegotiation-eligible drugs described in paragraph (2)(C).
Keywords: monopoly, negotiationeligible, drugs, secretary, select, renegotiation, eligible, described

Text: REMAINING DRUGS. Among the remaining renegotiation-eligible drugs described in subparagraphs (A) and (D) of paragraph (2), the Secretary shall select renegotiation-eligible drugs for which the Secretary expects renegotiation is likely to result in a significant change in the maximum fair price otherwise negotiated.
Keywords: remaining, drugs, renegotiation, eligible, described, subparagraphs, secretary, select, expects, likely, significant, maximum, fair, price, otherwise, negotiated

Text: RENEGOTIATION PROCESS.
Keywords: renegotiation, process

Text: IN GENERAL. The Secretary shall specify the process for renegotiation of maximum fair prices with the manufacturer of a renegotiation-eligible drug selected for renegotiation under this subsection.
Keywords: secretary, specify, process, renegotiation, maximum, fair, prices, manufacturer, eligible, drug, selected, subsection

Text: CONSISTENT WITH NEGOTIATION PROCESS. The process specified under subparagraph (A) shall, to the extent practicable, be consistent with the methodology and process established under subsection (b) and in accordance with subsections (c), (d), and (e), and for purposes of applying subsections (c)(1)(A) and (d), the reference to the first initial price applicability year of the price applicability period with respect to such drug shall be treated as the first initial price applicability year of such period for which the maximum fair price established pursuant to such renegotiation applies, including for applying subsection (c)(3)(B) in the case of renegotiation-eligible drugs described in paragraph (3)(A) of this subsection and subsection (c)(3)(C) in the case of renegotiation-eligible drugs described in paragraph (3)(B) of this subsection.
Keywords: consistent, negotiation, process, specified, subparagraph, extent, practicable, methodology, established, subsection, accordance, subsections, purposes, applying, reference, initial, price, applicability, period, respect, drug, treated, maximum, fair, pursuant, renegotiation, applies, case, eligible, drugs, described

Text: CLARIFICATION. A renegotiation-eligible drug for which the Secretary makes a determination described in section 1192(c)(1) before or during the period of renegotiation shall not be subject to the renegotiation process under this section.
Keywords: clarification, renegotiation, eligible, drug, secretary, determination, described, period, subject, process

Text: CLARIFICATION. The maximum fair price for a selected drug described in subparagraph (A) or (B) of paragraph (1) shall take effect no later than the first day of the first calendar quarter that begins after the date described in subparagraph (A) or (B), as applicable.
Keywords: clarification, maximum, fair, price, selected, drug, described, subparagraph, effect, calendar, quarter, begins, applicable

Keywords: respect, initial, price, applicability, selected, drug

Keywords: november, years, prior, initial, price, applicability, secretary, publish, maximum, fair, drug, negotiated, manufacturer

Text: not later than March 1 of the year prior to such initial price applicability year, the Secretary shall publish, subject to section 1193(c), the explanation for the maximum fair price with respect to the factors as applied under section 1194(e) for such drug described in paragraph (1).

Text: UPDATES.

Text: SUBSEQUENT YEAR MAXIMUM FAIR PRICES. For a selected drug, for each year subsequent to the first initial price applicability year of the price applicability period with respect to such drug, with respect to which an agreement for such drug is in effect under section 1193, not later than November 30 of the year that is 2 years prior to such subsequent year, the Secretary shall publish the maximum fair price applicable to such drug and year, which shall be
Keywords: subsequent, maximum, fair, prices, selected, drug, initial, price, applicability, period, respect, agreement, effect, november, years, prior, secretary, publish, applicable

Keywords: subject, subparagraph, amount, equal, maximum, fair, price, published, drug, increased, annual, percentage, increase, consumer, index, urban, consumers, united, states, city, average, month, period, ending, july, immediately, preceding, november

Text: in the case the maximum fair price for such drug was renegotiated, for the first year for which such price as so renegotiated applies, such renegotiated maximum fair price.

Text: PRICES NEGOTIATED AFTER DEADLINE. In the case of a selected drug with respect to an initial price applicability year for which the maximum fair price is determined under this part after the date of publication under this section, the Secretary shall publish such maximum fair price by not later than 30 days after the date such maximum price is so determined.
Keywords: prices, negotiated, deadline, case, selected, drug, respect, initial, price, applicability, maximum, fair, determined, publication, secretary, publish

Text: ADMINISTRATIVE DUTIES AND COMPLIANCE MONITORING.
Keywords: administrative, duties, compliance, monitoring

Text: ADMINISTRATIVE DUTIES. For purposes of section 1191(a)(4), the administrative duties described in this section are the following:
Keywords: administrative, duties, purposes, described

Text: The establishment of procedures to ensure that the maximum fair price for a selected drug is applied before
Keywords: establishment, procedures, ensure, maximum, fair, price, selected, drug, applied

Text: any coverage or financial assistance under other health benefit plans or programs that provide coverage or financial assistance for the purchase or provision of prescription drug coverage on behalf of maximum fair price eligible individuals; and
Keywords: coverage, financial, assistance, health, benefit, plans, programs, purchase, provision, prescription, drug, behalf, maximum, fair, price, eligible, individuals

Text: any other discounts.
Keywords: discounts

Text: The establishment of procedures to compute and apply the maximum fair price across different strengths and dosage forms of a selected drug and not based on the specific formulation or package size or package type of such drug.
Keywords: establishment, procedures, compute, apply, maximum, fair, price, across, strengths, dosage, forms, selected, drug, formulation, package, size, type

Text: The establishment of procedures to carry out the provisions of this part, as applicable, with respect to
Keywords: establishment, procedures, carry, provisions, applicable, respect

Text: maximum fair price eligible individuals who are enrolled in a prescription drug plan under part D of title XVIII or an MA–PD plan under part C of such title; and
Keywords: maximum, fair, price, eligible, individuals, enrolled, prescription, drug, plan, xviii, ma, pd

Text: maximum fair price eligible individuals who are enrolled under part B of such title, including who are enrolled in an MA plan under part C of such title.
Keywords: maximum, fair, price, eligible, individuals, enrolled, ma, plan

Text: The establishment of a negotiation process and renegotiation process in accordance with section 1194.
Keywords: establishment, negotiation, process, renegotiation, accordance

Text: The establishment of a process for manufacturers to submit information described in section 1194(b)(2)(A).
Keywords: establishment, process, manufacturers, submit, information, described

Text: The sharing with the Secretary of the Treasury of such information as is necessary to determine the tax imposed by section 5000D of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, including the application of such tax to a manufacturer, producer, or importer or the determination of any date described in section 5000D(c)(1) of such Code. For purposes of the preceding sentence, such information shall include
Keywords: sharing, secretary, treasury, information, necessary, determine, tax, imposed, 5000d, internal, revenue, code, application, manufacturer, producer, importer, determination, described, purposes, preceding, sentence

Text: the date on which the Secretary receives notification of any termination of an agreement under the Medicare coverage gap discount program under section 1860D-14A and the date on which any subsequent agreement under such program is entered into;
Keywords: secretary, receives, notification, termination, agreement, medicare, coverage, gap, discount, program, 1860d, 14a, subsequent, entered

Text: the date on which the Secretary receives notification of any termination of an agreement under the manufacturer discount program under section 1860D-14C and the date on which any subsequent agreement under such program is entered into; and
Keywords: secretary, receives, notification, termination, agreement, manufacturer, discount, program, 1860d, 14c, subsequent, entered

Text: the date on which the Secretary receives notification of any termination of a rebate agreement described in section 1927(b) and the date on which any subsequent rebate agreement described in such section is entered into.
Keywords: secretary, receives, notification, termination, rebate, agreement, described, subsequent, entered

Text: The establishment of procedures for purposes of applying section 1192(d)(2)(B).
Keywords: establishment, procedures, purposes, applying

Text: COMPLIANCE MONITORING. The Secretary shall monitor compliance by a manufacturer with the terms of an agreement under section 1193 and establish a mechanism through which violations of such terms shall be reported.
Keywords: compliance, monitoring, secretary, monitor, manufacturer, terms, agreement, establish, mechanism, violations, reported

Text: CIVIL MONETARY PENALTIES.
Keywords: civil, monetary, penalties

Text: VIOLATIONS RELATING TO OFFERING OF MAXIMUM FAIR PRICE. Any manufacturer of a selected drug that has entered into an agreement under section 1193, with respect to a year during the price applicability period with respect to such drug, that does not provide access to a price that is equal to or less than the maximum fair price for such drug for such year
Keywords: violations, relating, offering, maximum, fair, price, manufacturer, selected, drug, entered, agreement, respect, applicability, period, access, equal

Text: to a maximum fair price eligible individual who with respect to such drug is described in subparagraph (A) of section 1191(c)(2) and who is dispensed such drug during such year (and to pharmacies, mail order services, and other dispensers, with respect to such maximum fair price eligible individuals who are dispensed such drugs); or
Keywords: maximum, fair, price, eligible, individual, respect, drug, described, subparagraph, dispensed, pharmacies, mail, order, services, dispensers, individuals, drugs

Text: to a hospital, physician, or other provider of services or supplier with respect to maximum fair price eligible individuals who with respect to such drug is described in subparagraph (B) of such section and is furnished or administered such drug by such hospital, physician, or provider or supplier during such year; shall be subject to a civil monetary penalty equal to ten times the amount equal to the product of the number of units of such drug so furnished, dispensed, or administered during such year and the difference between the price for such drug made available for such year by such manufacturer with respect to such individual or hospital, physician, provider of services, or supplier and the maximum fair price for such drug for such year.
Keywords: hospital, physician, provider, services, supplier, respect, maximum, fair, price, eligible, individuals, drug, described, subparagraph, furnished, administered, subject, civil, monetary, penalty, equal, amount, product, number, units, dispensed, difference, available, manufacturer, individual

Text: VIOLATIONS OF CERTAIN TERMS OF AGREEMENT. Any manufacturer of a selected drug that has entered into an agreement under section 1193, with respect to a year during the price applicability period with respect to such drug, that is in violation of a requirement imposed pursuant to section 1193(a)(5), including the requirement to submit information pursuant to section 1193(a)(4), shall be subject to a civil monetary penalty equal to $1,000,000 for each day of such violation.
Keywords: violations, certain, terms, agreement, manufacturer, selected, drug, entered, respect, price, applicability, period, violation, requirement, imposed, pursuant, submit, information, subject, civil, monetary, penalty, equal, 1,000,000

Text: IN GENERAL. Subject to subparagraph (B), in the case of a biological product that would (but for this subsection) be an extended-monopoly drug (as defined in section 1194(c)(4)) included as a selected drug on the list published under subsection (a) with respect to an initial price applicability year, the rules described in paragraph (2) shall apply if the Secretary determines that there is a high likelihood (as described in paragraph (3)) that a biosimilar biological product (for which such biological product will be the reference product) will be licensed and marketed under section 351(k) of the Public Health Service Act before the date that is 2 years after the selected drug publication date with respect to such initial price applicability year.

Text: IN GENERAL. Keywords: case, biological, product, respect, rebate, required, paid, qualifies, monopoly, drug, defined, inclusion, published, subsection, determining, amount, subparagraph

Text: AMOUNT DESCRIBED. The amount described in this clause is an amount equal to 65 percent of the average non-Federal average manufacturer price for the biological product for 2021 (or, in the case that there is not an average non-Federal average manufacturer price available for such biological product for 2021, for the first full year following the market entry for such biological product), increased by the percentage increase in the consumer price index for all urban consumers (all items; United States city average) from September 2021 (or December of such first full year following the market entry), as applicable, to September of the year prior to the selected drug publication date with respect to the initial price applicability year that would have applied but for this subsection.

Text: MANUFACTURER REQUIREMENT. Text: SUBSEQUENTLY APPROVED DRUGS. In the case of a part B rebatable drug first approved or licensed by the Food and Drug Administration after December 1, 2020, clause (i) of paragraph (3)(C) shall be applied as if the term ‘payment amount benchmark quarter’ were defined under paragraph (3)(D) as the third full calendar quarter after the day on which the drug was first marketed and clause (ii) of paragraph (3)(C) shall be applied as if the term ‘benchmark period CPI–U’ were defined under paragraph (3)(E) as if the reference to ‘January 2021’ under such paragraph were a reference to ‘the first month of the first full calendar quarter after the day on which the drug was first marketed’.
Keywords: subsequently, approved, drugs, case, rebatable, drug, licensed, food, administration, december, clause, applied, term, payment, amount, benchmark, quarter, defined, calendar, marketed

Text: TIMELINE FOR PROVISION OF REBATES FOR SUBSEQUENTLY APPROVED DRUGS. In the case of a part B rebatable drug first approved or licensed by the Food and Drug Administration after December 1, 2020, paragraph (1)(B) shall be applied as if the reference to ‘January 1, 2023’ under such paragraph were a reference to ‘the later of the 6th full calendar quarter after the day on which the drug was first marketed or January 1, 2023’.
Keywords: timeline, provision, rebates, subsequently, approved, drugs, case, rebatable, drug, licensed, food, administration, december, applied, reference, january, 6th, calendar, quarter, marketed

Text: SELECTED DRUGS. In the case of a part B rebatable drug that is a selected drug (as defined in section 1192(c)) with respect to a price applicability period (as defined in section 1191(b)(2)), in the case such drug is no longer considered to be a selected drug under section 1192(c), for each applicable period (as defined under subsection (g)(7)) beginning after the price applicability period with respect to such drug, clause (i) of paragraph (3)(C) shall be applied as if the term ‘payment amount benchmark quarter’ were defined under paragraph (3)(D) as the calendar quarter beginning January 1 of the last year during such price applicability period with respect to such selected drug and clause (ii) of paragraph (3)(C) shall be applied as if the term ‘benchmark period CPI–U’ were defined under paragraph (3)(E) as if the reference to ‘January 2021’ under such paragraph were a reference to ‘the July of the year preceding such last year’.
Keywords: selected, drugs, case, rebatable, drug, defined, respect, price, applicability, period, longer, considered, applicable, subsection, beginning, clause, applied, term, payment, amount, benchmark, quarter, calendar, january, cpi, reference, july, preceding

Text: CIVIL MONEY PENALTY. If a manufacturer of a part B rebatable drug has failed to comply with the requirements under paragraph (1)(B) for such drug for a calendar quarter, the manufacturer shall be subject to, in accordance with a process established by the Secretary pursuant to regulations, a civil money penalty in an amount equal to at least 125 percent of the amount specified in paragraph (3) for such drug for such calendar quarter. The provisions of section 1128A (other than subsections (a) (with respect to amounts of penalties or additional assessments) and (b)) shall apply to a civil money penalty under this paragraph in the same manner as such provisions apply to a penalty or proceeding under section 1128A(a).

Text: IN GENERAL. In the case of a part D rebatable drug that is a line extension of a part D rebatable drug that is an oral solid dosage form, the Secretary shall establish a formula for determining the rebate amount under paragraph (1) and the inflation adjusted payment amount under paragraph (3) with respect to such part D rebatable drug and an applicable period, consistent with the formula applied under subsection (c)(2)(C) of section 1927 for determining a rebate obligation for a rebate period under such section.

Text: LINE EXTENSION DEFINED. In this subparagraph, the term ‘line extension’ means, with respect to a part D rebatable drug, a new formulation of the drug, such as an extended release formulation, but does not include an abuse-deterrent formulation of the drug (as determined by the Secretary), regardless of whether such abuse-deterrent formulation is an extended release formulation.
Keywords: line, extension, defined, subparagraph, term, respect, rebatable, drug, new, formulation, extended, release, abuse, deterrent, determined, secretary, regardless

Text: SELECTED DRUGS. Text: RECONCILIATION IN CASE OF REVISED INFORMATION. The Secretary shall provide for a method and process under which, in the case where a PDP sponsor of a prescription drug plan or an MA organization offering an MA–PD plan submits revisions to the number of units of a rebatable covered part D drug dispensed, the Secretary determines, pursuant to such revisions, adjustments, if any, to the calculation of the amount specified in this subsection for a dosage form and strength with respect to such part D rebatable drug and an applicable period and reconciles any overpayments or underpayments in amounts paid as rebates under this subsection. Any identified underpayment shall be rectified by the manufacturer not later than 30 days after the date of receipt from the Secretary of information on such underpayment.

Text: APPLICABLE PERIOD CPI–U. The term ‘applicable period CPI–U’ means, with respect to an applicable period, the consumer price index for all urban consumers (United States city average) for the first month of such applicable period.

Text: IN GENERAL. Part D of title XVIII of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395w–101 through 42 U.S.C. 1395w–153), as amended by section 11102, is amended by inserting after section 1860D–14B the following new sections:
Keywords: xviii, social, security, act, u.s.c, 1395w, amended, inserting, 1860d, 14b, new, sections

Text: MANUFACTURER DISCOUNT PROGRAM.
Keywords: manufacturer, discount, program

Text: ESTABLISHMENT. The Secretary shall establish a manufacturer discount program (in this section referred to as the ‘program’). Under the program, the Secretary shall enter into agreements described in subsection (b) with manufacturers and provide for the performance of the duties described in subsection (c).
Keywords: establishment, secretary, establish, manufacturer, discount, program, referred, agreements, described, subsection, manufacturers, performance, duties

Text: TERMS OF AGREEMENT.
Keywords: terms, agreement

Text: IN GENERAL.

AGREEMENT. An agreement under this section shall require the manufacturer to provide, in accordance with this section, discounted prices for applicable drugs of the manufacturer that are dispensed to applicable beneficiaries on or after January 1, 2025.
Keywords: agreement, require, manufacturer, accordance, discounted, prices, applicable, drugs, dispensed, beneficiaries, january

Text: CLARIFICATION. Nothing in this section shall be construed as affecting
Keywords: clarification, nothing, construed, affecting

Text: the application of a coinsurance of 25 percent of the negotiated price, as applied under paragraph (2)(A) of section 1860D–2(b), for costs described in such paragraph; or
Keywords: application, coinsurance, negotiated, price, applied, 1860d, costs, described

Text: the application of the copayment amount described in paragraph (4)(A) of such section, with respect to costs described in such paragraph.
Keywords: application, copayment, amount, described, respect, costs

Text: TIMING OF AGREEMENT.
Keywords: timing, agreement

Text: SPECIAL RULE FOR 2025. In order for an agreement with a manufacturer to be in effect under this section with respect to the period beginning on January 1, 2025, and ending on December 31, 2025, the manufacturer shall enter into such agreement not later than March 1, 2024.
Keywords: special, rule, order, agreement, manufacturer, effect, respect, period, beginning, january, ending, december, march

Text: 2026 AND SUBSEQUENT YEARS. In order for an agreement with a manufacturer to be in effect under this section with respect to plan year 2026 or a subsequent plan year, the manufacturer shall enter into such agreement not later than a calendar quarter or semi-annual deadline established by the Secretary.
Keywords: subsequent, years, order, agreement, manufacturer, effect, respect, plan, calendar, quarter, semi, annual, deadline, established, secretary

Text: PROVISION OF APPROPRIATE DATA. Each manufacturer with an agreement in effect under this section shall collect and have available appropriate data, as determined by the Secretary, to ensure that it can demonstrate to the Secretary compliance with the requirements under the program.
Keywords: provision, appropriate, data, manufacturer, agreement, effect, collect, available, determined, secretary, ensure, demonstrate, compliance, requirements, program

Text: COMPLIANCE WITH REQUIREMENTS FOR ADMINISTRATION OF PROGRAM. Each manufacturer with an agreement in effect under this section shall comply with requirements imposed by the Secretary, as applicable, for purposes of administering the program, including any determination under subparagraph (A) of subsection (c)(1) or procedures established under such subsection (c)(1).
Keywords: compliance, requirements, administration, program, manufacturer, agreement, effect, comply, imposed, secretary, applicable, purposes, administering, determination, subparagraph, subsection, procedures, established

Text: LENGTH OF AGREEMENT.
Keywords: length, agreement

Text: IN GENERAL. An agreement under this section shall be effective for an initial period of not less than 12 months and shall be automatically renewed for a period of not less than 1 year unless terminated under subparagraph (B).
Keywords: agreement, effective, initial, period, months, automatically, renewed, unless, terminated, subparagraph

Text: TERMINATION.
Keywords: termination

Text: BY THE SECRETARY. The Secretary shall provide for termination of an agreement under this section for a knowing and willful violation of the requirements of the agreement or other good cause shown. Such termination shall not be effective earlier than 30 days after the date of notice to the manufacturer of such termination. The Secretary shall provide, upon request, a manufacturer with a hearing concerning such a termination, and such hearing shall take place prior to the effective date of the termination with sufficient time for such effective date to be repealed if the Secretary determines appropriate.
Keywords: secretary, termination, agreement, knowing, willful, violation, requirements, cause, shown, effective, earlier, notice, manufacturer, request, hearing, concerning, prior, sufficient, repealed, determines, appropriate

Text: BY A MANUFACTURER. A manufacturer may terminate an agreement under this section for any reason. Any such termination shall be effective, with respect to a plan year
Keywords: manufacturer, terminate, agreement, reason, termination, effective, respect, plan

Text: if the termination occurs before January 31 of a plan year, as of the day after the end of the plan year; and
Keywords: termination, occurs, january, plan

Text: if the termination occurs on or after January 31 of a plan year, as of the day after the end of the succeeding plan year.
Keywords: termination, occurs, january, plan, succeeding

Text: EFFECTIVENESS OF TERMINATION. Any termination under this subparagraph shall not affect discounts for applicable drugs of the manufacturer that are due under the agreement before the effective date of its termination.
Keywords: effectiveness, termination, subparagraph, affect, discounts, applicable, drugs, manufacturer, agreement, effective

Text: EFFECTIVE DATE OF AGREEMENT. An agreement under this section shall take effect at the start of a calendar quarter or another date specified by the Secretary.
Keywords: effective, agreement, effect, calendar, quarter, specified, secretary

Text: DUTIES DESCRIBED. The duties described in this subsection are the following:
Keywords: duties, described, subsection

Text: ADMINISTRATION OF PROGRAM. Administering the program, including
Keywords: administration, program, administering

Text: the determination of the amount of the discounted price of an applicable drug of a manufacturer;
Keywords: determination, amount, discounted, price, applicable, drug, manufacturer

Text: the establishment of procedures to ensure that, not later than the applicable number of calendar days after the dispensing of an applicable drug by a pharmacy or mail order service, the pharmacy or mail order service is reimbursed for an amount equal to the difference between
Keywords: establishment, procedures, ensure, applicable, number, calendar, dispensing, drug, pharmacy, mail, order, service, reimbursed, amount, equal, difference

Text: the negotiated price of the applicable drug; and
Keywords: negotiated, price, applicable, drug

Text: the discounted price of the applicable drug;
Keywords: discounted, price, applicable, drug

Text: the establishment of procedures to ensure that the discounted price for an applicable drug under this section is applied before any coverage or financial assistance under other health benefit plans or programs that provide coverage or financial assistance for the purchase or provision of prescription drug coverage on behalf of applicable beneficiaries as specified by the Secretary; and
Keywords: establishment, procedures, ensure, discounted, price, applicable, drug, applied, coverage, financial, assistance, health, benefit, plans, programs, purchase, provision, prescription, behalf, beneficiaries, specified, secretary

Text: providing a reasonable dispute resolution mechanism to resolve disagreements between manufacturers, prescription drug plans and MA–PD plans, and the Secretary.
Keywords: providing, reasonable, dispute, resolution, mechanism, resolve, disagreements, manufacturers, prescription, drug, plans, ma, pd, secretary

Text: MONITORING COMPLIANCE. The Secretary shall monitor compliance by a manufacturer with the terms of an agreement under this section.
Keywords: monitoring, compliance, secretary, monitor, manufacturer, terms, agreement

Text: COLLECTION OF DATA FROM PRESCRIPTION DRUG PLANS AND MA–PD PLANS. The Secretary may collect appropriate data from prescription drug plans and MA–PD plans in a timeframe that allows for discounted prices to be provided for applicable drugs under this section.
Keywords: collection, data, prescription, drug, plans, ma, pd, secretary, collect, appropriate, timeframe, allows, discounted, prices, applicable, drugs

Text: ADMINISTRATION.
Keywords: administration

Text: IN GENERAL. Subject to paragraph (2), the Secretary shall provide for the implementation of this section, including the performance of the duties described in subsection (c).
Keywords: subject, secretary, implementation, performance, duties, described, subsection

Text: LIMITATION. In providing for the implementation of this section, the Secretary shall not receive or distribute any funds of a manufacturer under the program.
Keywords: limitation, providing, implementation, secretary, distribute, funds, manufacturer, program

Text: CIVIL MONEY PENALTY.
Keywords: civil, money, penalty

Text: IN GENERAL. A manufacturer that fails to provide discounted prices for applicable drugs of the manufacturer dispensed to applicable beneficiaries in accordance with an agreement in effect under this section shall be subject to a civil money penalty for each such failure in an amount the Secretary determines is equal to the sum of
Keywords: manufacturer, fails, discounted, prices, applicable, drugs, dispensed, beneficiaries, accordance, agreement, effect, subject, civil, money, penalty, failure, amount, secretary, determines, equal, sum

Text: the amount that the manufacturer would have paid with respect to such discounts under the agreement, which will then be used to pay the discounts which the manufacturer had failed to provide; and
Keywords: amount, manufacturer, paid, respect, discounts, agreement, failed

Text: 25 percent of such amount.
Keywords: amount

Text: APPLICATION. The provisions of section 1128A (other than subsections (a) and (b)) shall apply to a civil money penalty under this subsection in the same manner as such provisions apply to a penalty or proceeding under section 1128A(a).
Keywords: application, provisions, 1128a, subsections, apply, civil, money, penalty, subsection, manner, proceeding

Text: CLARIFICATION REGARDING AVAILABILITY OF OTHER COVERED PART D DRUGS. Nothing in this section shall prevent an applicable beneficiary from purchasing a covered part D drug that is not an applicable drug (including a generic drug or a drug that is not on the formulary of the prescription drug plan or MA–PD plan that the applicable beneficiary is enrolled in).
Keywords: clarification, regarding, availability, covered, drugs, nothing, prevent, applicable, beneficiary, purchasing, drug, generic, formulary, prescription, plan, ma, pd, enrolled

Keywords: definitions

Keywords: approved, new, drug, application, federal, food, cosmetic, act, case, biologic, product, licensed, public, health, service

Text: CLAIMS SPANNING DEDUCTIBLE. In the case where the entire amount of the negotiated price of an individual claim for an applicable drug with respect to an applicable beneficiary does not fall above the annual deductible specified in section 1860D–2(b)(1) for the year, the manufacturer of the applicable drug shall provide the discounted price under this section on only the portion of the negotiated price of the applicable drug that falls above such annual deductible.

Text: MANUFACTURER. The term ‘manufacturer’ means any entity which is engaged in the production, preparation, propagation, compounding, conversion, or processing of prescription drug products, either directly or indirectly by extraction from substances of natural origin, or independently by means of chemical synthesis, or by a combination of extraction and chemical synthesis. Such term does not include a wholesale distributor of drugs or a retail pharmacy licensed under State law.

Text: SELECTED DRUG SUBSIDY PROGRAM. ‘‘With respect to covered part D drugs that would be applicable drugs (as defined in section 1860D–14C(g)(2)) but for the application of subparagraph (B) of such section, the Secretary shall provide a process whereby, in the case of an applicable beneficiary (as defined in section 1860D– 14C(g)(1)) who, with respect to a year, is enrolled in a prescription drug plan or is enrolled in an MA–PD plan, has not incurred costs that are equal to or exceed the annual out-of-pocket threshold specified in section 1860D– 2(b)(4)(B)(i), and is dispensed such a drug, the Secretary (periodically and on a timely basis) provides the PDP sponsor or the MA organization offering the plan, a subsidy with respect to such drug that is equal to 10 percent of the negotiated price (as defined in section 1860D–14C(g)(6)) of such drug.’’.

Text: IN GENERAL. For plan years beginning on or after January 1, 2025, each PDP sponsor offering a prescription drug plan and each MA organization offering an MA–PD plan shall provide to any enrollee of such plan, including an enrollee who is a subsidy eligible individual (as defined in paragraph (3) of section 1860D–14(a)), the option to elect with respect to a plan year to pay cost-sharing under the plan in monthly amounts that are capped in accordance with this subparagraph.

Text: DETERMINATION OF MAXIMUM MONTHLY CAP. For each month in the plan year for which an enrollee in a prescription drug plan or an MA–PD plan has made an election pursuant to clause (i), the PDP sponsor or MA organization shall determine a maximum monthly cap (as defined in clause (iv)) for such enrollee.
Keywords: determination, maximum, monthly, cap, month, plan, enrollee, prescription, drug, ma, pd, election, pursuant, clause, pdp, sponsor, organization, determine, defined, iv

Text: BENEFICIARY MONTHLY PAYMENTS. With respect to an enrollee who has made an election pursuant to clause (i), for each month described in clause (ii), the PDP sponsor or MA organization shall bill such enrollee an amount (not to exceed the maximum monthly cap) for the out-of-pocket costs of such enrollee in such month.

Text: PLAN YEARS 2023 AND 2024. For plan years 2023 and 2024, the coverage provides benefits for any covered insulin product, regardless of whether an individual has reached the initial coverage limit under paragraph (3) or the out-of-pocket threshold under paragraph (4), with cost-sharing for a month’s supply that does not exceed the applicable copayment amount.

Text: PLAN YEAR 2025 AND SUBSEQUENT PLAN YEARS. Keywords: eligible, property, purposes, term, energy

Text: ALLOCATIONS.
Keywords: allocations

Text: IN GENERAL. Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this subsection, the Secretary shall establish a program to allocate amounts of environmental justice solar and wind capacity limitation to qualified solar and wind facilities. In establishing such program and to carry out the purposes of this subsection, the Secretary shall provide procedures to allow for an efficient allocation process, including, when determined appropriate, consideration of multiple projects in a single application if such projects will be placed in service by a single taxpayer.
Keywords: enactment, subsection, secretary, establish, program, allocate, amounts, environmental, justice, solar, wind, capacity, limitation, qualified, facilities, establishing, carry, purposes, procedures, allow, efficient, allocation, process, determined, appropriate, consideration, multiple, projects, application, placed, service, taxpayer

Text: LIMITATION. The amount of environmental justice solar and wind capacity limitation allocated by the Secretary under subparagraph (A) during any calendar year shall not exceed the annual capacity limitation with respect to such year.
Keywords: limitation, amount, environmental, justice, solar, wind, capacity, allocated, secretary, subparagraph, calendar, exceed, annual, respect

Text: ANNUAL CAPACITY LIMITATION. For purposes of this paragraph, the term ‘annual capacity limitation’ means 1.8 gigawatts of direct current capacity for each of calendar years 2023 and 2024, and zero thereafter.
Keywords: annual, capacity, limitation, purposes, term, gigawatts, direct, calendar, years, zero, thereafter

Text: CARRYOVER OF UNUSED LIMITATION. If the annual capacity limitation for any calendar year exceeds the aggregate amount allocated for such year under this paragraph, such limitation for the succeeding calendar year shall be increased by the amount of such excess. No amount may be carried under the preceding sentence to any calendar year after 2024 except as provided in section 48E(h)(4)(D)(ii).
Keywords: carryover, unused, limitation, annual, capacity, calendar, exceeds, aggregate, amount, allocated, succeeding, increased, excess, carried, preceding, sentence, except, 48e

Text: PLACED IN SERVICE DEADLINE.
Keywords: placed, service, deadline

Text: IN GENERAL. Paragraph (1) shall not apply with respect to any property which is placed in service after the date that is 4 years after the date of the allocation with respect to the facility of which such property is a part.
Keywords: apply, respect, property, placed, service, years, allocation, facility

Text: APPLICATION OF CARRYOVER. Any amount of environmental justice solar and wind capacity limitation which expires under clause (i) during any calendar year shall be taken into account as an excess described in subparagraph (D) (or as an increase in such excess) for such calendar year, subject to the limitation imposed by the last sentence of such subparagraph.
Keywords: application, carryover, amount, environmental, justice, solar, wind, capacity, limitation, expires, clause, calendar, account, excess, described, subparagraph, increase, subject, imposed, sentence

Text: RECAPTURE. The Secretary shall, by regulations or other guidance, provide for recapturing the benefit of any increase in the credit allowed under subsection (a) by reason of this subsection with respect to any property which ceases to be property eligible for such increase (but which does not cease to be investment credit property within the meaning of section 50(a)). The period and percentage of such recapture shall be determined under rules similar to the rules of section 50(a). To the extent provided by the Secretary, such recapture may not apply with respect to any property if, within 12 months after the date the taxpayer becomes aware (or reasonably should have become aware) of such property ceasing to be property eligible for such increase, the eligibility of such property for such increase is restored. The preceding sentence shall not apply more than once with respect to any facility.’’.
Keywords: recapture, secretary, regulations, guidance, recapturing, benefit, increase, credit, allowed, subsection, reason, respect, property, ceases, eligible, cease, investment, meaning, period, percentage, determined, rules, extent, apply, months, taxpayer, becomes, aware, reasonably, ceasing, eligibility, restored, preceding, sentence, facility

Text: IN GENERAL. Text: ZERO-EMISSION CREDIT PROGRAM. For purposes of this subparagraph, the term ‘zero-emission credit program’ means any payments with respect to a qualified nuclear power facility as a result of any Federal, State or local government program for, in whole or in part, the zeroemission, zero-carbon, or air quality attributes of any portion of the electricity produced by such facility.

Text: EXCLUSION. Text: OTHER RULES.
