Text: INFLATION ADJUSTMENT. The 0.3 cent amount in subsection (a)(1)(A) and the 2.5 cent amount in subsection (b)(2)(A)(ii)(II)(aa) shall each be adjusted by multiplying such amount by the inflation adjustment factor (as determined under section 45(e)(2), as applied by substituting ‘calendar year 2023’ for ‘calendar year 1992’ in subparagraph (B) thereof) for the calendar year in which the sale occurs. If the 0.3 cent amount as increased under this paragraph is not a multiple of 0.05 cent, such amount shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of 0.05 cent. If the 2.5 cent amount as increased under this paragraph is not a multiple of 0.1 cent, such amount shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of 0.1 cent.
Keywords: inflation, adjustment, cent, amount, subsection, aa, adjusted, multiplying, factor, determined, applied, substituting, calendar, subparagraph, thereof, sale, occurs, increased, multiple, rounded, nearest

Text: IN GENERAL. Text: SPECIAL RULE. In the case of any alternative fuel credit properly determined under section 6426(d) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 for the period beginning on January 1, 2022, and ending with the close of the last calendar quarter beginning before the date of the enactment of this Act, such credit shall be allowed, and any refund or payment attributable to such credit (including any payment under section 6427(e) of such Code) shall be made, only in such manner as the Secretary of the Treasury (or the Secretary’s delegate) shall provide. Such Secretary shall issue guidance within 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act providing for a one-time submission of claims covering periods described in the preceding sentence. Such guidance shall provide for a 180-day period for the submission of such claims (in such manner as prescribed by such Secretary) to begin not later than 30 days after such guidance is issued. Such claims shall be paid by such Secretary not later than 60 days after receipt. If such Secretary has not paid pursuant to a claim filed under this subsection within 60 days after the date of the filing of such claim, the claim shall be paid with interest from such date determined by using the overpayment rate and method under section 6621 of such Code.
Keywords: special, rule, case, alternative, fuel, credit, properly, determined, internal, revenue, code, period, beginning, january, ending, calendar, quarter, enactment, act, allowed, refund, payment, attributable, manner, secretary, treasury, secretary’s, delegate, issue, guidance, providing, submission, claims, covering, periods, described, preceding, sentence, prescribed, begin, issued, paid, receipt, pursuant, claim, filed, subsection, filing, interest, overpayment, rate, method

Text: APPLICABLE SUPPLEMENTARY AMOUNT. For purposes of this section, the term ‘applicable supplementary amount’ means, with respect to any sustainable aviation fuel, an amount equal to $0.01 for each percentage point by which the lifecycle greenhouse gas emissions reduction percentage with respect to such fuel exceeds 50 percent. In no event shall the applicable supplementary amount determined under this subsection exceed $0.50.

Text: GREET MODEL. Text: IN GENERAL. For purposes of section 38, the qualified commercial clean vehicle credit for any taxable year is an amount equal to the sum of the credit amounts determined under subsection (b) with respect to each qualified commercial clean vehicle placed in service by the taxpayer during the taxable year.

Keywords: subject, amount, determined, subsection, respect, qualified, commercial, clean, vehicle, equal, lesser

Keywords: basis, vehicle, case, powered, gasoline, diesel, internal, combustion, engine

Keywords: incremental, cost, vehicle

Text: INCREMENTAL COST. For purposes of paragraph (1)(B), the incremental cost of any qualified commercial clean vehicle is an amount equal to the excess of the purchase price for such vehicle over such price of a comparable vehicle.

Text: COMPARABLE VEHICLE. For purposes of this subsection, the term ‘comparable vehicle’ means, with respect to any qualified commercial clean vehicle, any vehicle which is powered solely by a gasoline or diesel internal combustion engine and which is comparable in size and use to such vehicle.

Text: IN GENERAL. Text: QUALIFIED ALTERNATIVE FUEL VEHICLE REFUELING PROJECT. For purposes of this subsection, the term ‘qualified alternative fuel vehicle refueling project’ means a project consisting of one or more properties that are part of a single project.

Text: PROJECT REQUIREMENTS. A project meets the requirements of this subparagraph if it is one of the following:

Text: A project the construction of which begins prior to the date that is 60 days after the Secretary publishes guidance with respect to the requirements of paragraphs (2)(A) and (3).
Keywords: project, construction, begins, prior, secretary, publishes, guidance, respect, requirements, paragraphs

Text: A project which satisfies the requirements of paragraphs (2)(A) and (3).

Text: PREVAILING WAGE REQUIREMENTS.

Text: IN GENERAL. The requirements described in this subparagraph with respect to any qualified alternative fuel vehicle refueling project are that the taxpayer shall ensure that any laborers and mechanics employed by the taxpayer or any contractor or subcontractor in the construction of any qualified alternative fuel vehicle refueling property which is part of such project shall be paid wages at rates not less than the prevailing rates for construction, alteration, or repair of a similar character in the locality in which such project is located as most recently determined by the Secretary of Labor, in accordance with subchapter IV of chapter 31 of title 40, United States Code.

Text: TIME TO MEET CRITERIA FOR CERTIFICATION. Each applicant for certification shall have 2 years from the date of acceptance by the Secretary of the application during which to provide to the Secretary evidence that the requirements of the certification have been met.
Keywords: criteria, certification, applicant, years, acceptance, secretary, application, evidence, requirements, met

Text: PERIOD OF ISSUANCE. An applicant which receives a certification shall have 2 years from the date of issuance of the certification in order to place the project in service and to notify the Secretary that such project has been so placed in service, and if such project is not placed in service by that time period, then the certification shall no longer be valid. If any certification is revoked under this subparagraph, the amount of the limitation under paragraph (2) shall be increased by the amount of the credit with respect to such revoked certification.
Keywords: period, issuance, applicant, receives, certification, years, order, project, service, notify, secretary, placed, longer, valid, revoked, subparagraph, amount, limitation, increased, credit, respect

Text: LOCATION OF PROJECT. In the case of an applicant which receives a certification, if the Secretary determines that the project has been placed in service at a location which is materially different than the location specified in the application for such project, the certification shall no longer be valid.
Keywords: project, case, applicant, receives, certification, secretary, determines, placed, service, materially, specified, application, longer, valid

Text: CREDIT RATE CONDITIONED UPON WAGE AND APPRENTICESHIP REQUIREMENTS.
Keywords: credit, rate, conditioned, wage, apprenticeship, requirements

Text: BASE RATE. For purposes of allocations under this subsection, the amount of the credit determined under subsection (a) shall be determined by substituting ‘6 percent’ for ‘30 percent’.
Keywords: base, rate, purposes, allocations, subsection, amount, credit, determined, substituting

Text: ALTERNATIVE RATE. In the case of any project which satisfies the requirements of paragraphs (5)(A) and (6), subparagraph (A) shall not apply.
Keywords: alternative, rate, case, project, satisfies, requirements, paragraphs, subparagraph, apply

Text: PREVAILING WAGE REQUIREMENTS.
Keywords: prevailing, wage, requirements

Text: IN GENERAL. The requirements described in this subparagraph with respect to a project are that the taxpayer shall ensure that any laborers and mechanics employed by the taxpayer or any contractor or subcontractor in the re-equipping, expansion, or establishment of a manufacturing facility shall be paid wages at rates not less than the prevailing rates for construction, alteration, or repair of a similar character in the locality in which such project is located as most recently determined by the Secretary of Labor, in accordance with subchapter IV of chapter 31 of title 40, United States Code.
Keywords: requirements, described, subparagraph, respect, project, taxpayer, ensure, laborers, mechanics, employed, contractor, subcontractor, equipping, expansion, establishment, manufacturing, facility, paid, wages, rates, prevailing, construction, alteration, repair, character, locality, located, recently, determined, secretary, labor, accordance, iv, united, states, code

Text: CORRECTION AND PENALTY RELATED TO FAILURE TO SATISFY WAGE REQUIREMENTS. Rules similar to the rules of section 45(b)(7)(B) shall apply.
Keywords: correction, penalty, related, failure, satisfy, wage, requirements, rules, apply

Text: APPRENTICESHIP REQUIREMENTS. Rules similar to the rules of section 45(b)(8) shall apply.
Keywords: apprenticeship, requirements, rules, apply

Text: DISCLOSURE OF ALLOCATIONS. The Secretary shall, upon making a certification under this subsection, publicly disclose the identity of the applicant and the amount of the credit with respect to such applicant.’’.

Text: IN GENERAL.

ALLOWANCE OF CREDIT. For purposes of section 38, the advanced manufacturing production credit for any taxable year is an amount equal to the sum of the credit amounts determined under subsection (b) with respect to each eligible component which is
Keywords: allowance, credit, purposes, advanced, manufacturing, production, taxable, amount, equal, sum, amounts, determined, subsection, respect, eligible, component

Keywords: produced, taxpayer

Keywords: taxable, sold, taxpayer, unrelated

Text: PRODUCTION AND SALE MUST BE IN TRADE OR BUSINESS. Any eligible component produced and sold by the taxpayer shall be taken into account only if the production and sale described in paragraph (1) is in a trade or business of the taxpayer.
Keywords: production, sale, trade, business, eligible, component, produced, sold, taxpayer, account, described

Text: UNRELATED PERSON.
Keywords: unrelated

Text: IN GENERAL. For purposes of this subsection, a taxpayer shall be treated as selling components to an unrelated person if such component is sold to such person by a person related to the taxpayer.
Keywords: purposes, subsection, taxpayer, treated, selling, components, unrelated, component, sold, related

Text: ELECTION.
Keywords: election

Text: IN GENERAL. At the election of the taxpayer (in such form and manner as the Secretary may prescribe), a sale of components by such taxpayer to a related person shall be deemed to have been made to an unrelated person.
Keywords: election, taxpayer, form, manner, secretary, prescribe, sale, components, related, deemed, unrelated

Text: REQUIREMENT. As a condition of, and prior to, any election described in clause (i), the Secretary may require such information or registration as the Secretary deems necessary for purposes of preventing duplication, fraud, or any improper or excessive amount determined under paragraph (1).

Keywords: purposes, subparagraph, capacity, determined, respect, battery, cell, module, exceed, power, ratio

Text: CAPACITY-TO-POWER RATIO. For purposes of this paragraph, the term ‘capacity-topower ratio’ means, with respect to a battery cell or battery module, the ratio of the capacity of such cell or module to the maximum discharge amount of such cell or module.

Text: APPLICATION WITH OTHER CREDITS. Text: NACELLE. The term ‘nacelle’ means the assembly of the drivetrain and other tower-top components of a wind turbine (with the exception of the blades and the hub) within their cover housing.

Text: RELATED OFFSHORE WIND VESSEL. The term ‘related offshore wind vessel’ means any vessel which is purpose-built or retrofitted for purposes of the development, transport, installation, operation, or maintenance of offshore wind energy components.

Text: TOWER. The term ‘tower’ means a tubular or lattice structure which supports the nacelle and rotor of a wind turbine.

Keywords: qualified, facility

Text: IN GENERAL.
DEFINITION. Subject to subparagraphs (B), (C), and (D), the term ‘qualified facility’ means a facility owned by the taxpayer
Keywords: definition, subject, subparagraphs, term, qualified, facility, owned, taxpayer

Keywords: generation, electricity

Keywords: placed, service, december

Keywords: greenhouse, gas, emissions, rate, determined, greater, zero

Text: 10-YEAR PRODUCTION CREDIT. For purposes of this section, a facility shall only be treated as a qualified facility during the 10-year period beginning on the date the facility was originally placed in service.
Keywords: production, credit, purposes, facility, treated, qualified, period, beginning, originally, placed, service

Text: EXPANSION OF FACILITY; INCREMENTAL PRODUCTION. The term ‘qualified facility’ shall include either of the following in connection with a facility described in subparagraph (A) (without regard to clause (ii) of such subparagraph) which was placed in service before January 1, 2025, but only to the extent of the increased amount of electricity produced at the facility by reason of the following:
Keywords: expansion, facility, incremental, production, term, qualified, connection, described, subparagraph, regard, clause, placed, service, january, extent, increased, amount, electricity, produced, reason

Text: A new unit which is placed in service after December 31, 2024.
Keywords: new, unit, placed, service, december

Text: Any additions of capacity which are placed in service after December 31, 2024.
Keywords: additions, capacity, placed, service, december

Text: COORDINATION WITH OTHER CREDITS. The term ‘qualified facility’ shall not include any facility for which a credit determined under section 45, 45J, 45Q, 45U, 48, 48A, or 48E is allowed under section 38 for the taxable year or any prior taxable year.
Keywords: coordination, credits, term, qualified, facility, credit, determined, 45j, 45q, 45u, 48a, 48e, allowed, taxable, prior

Text: GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS RATE.
Keywords: greenhouse, gas, emissions, rate

Text: IN GENERAL. For purposes of this section, the term ‘greenhouse gas emissions rate’ means the amount of greenhouse gases emitted into the atmosphere by a facility in the production of electricity, expressed as grams of CO2e per KWh.
Keywords: purposes, term, greenhouse, gas, emissions, rate, amount, gases, emitted, atmosphere, facility, production, electricity, expressed, grams, co2e, kwh

Text: FUEL COMBUSTION AND GASIFICATION. In the case of a facility which produces electricity through combustion or gasification, the greenhouse gas emissions rate for such facility shall be equal to the net rate of greenhouse gases emitted into the atmosphere by such facility (taking into account lifecycle greenhouse gas emissions, as described in section 211(o)(1)(H) of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7545(o)(1)(H))) in the production of electricity, expressed as grams of CO2e per KWh.
Keywords: fuel, combustion, gasification, case, facility, produces, electricity, greenhouse, gas, emissions, rate, equal, gases, emitted, atmosphere, taking, account, lifecycle, described, clean, air, act, u.s.c, production, expressed, grams, co2e, kwh

Text: ESTABLISHMENT OF EMISSIONS RATES FOR FACILITIES.
Keywords: establishment, emissions, rates, facilities

Text: PUBLISHING EMISSIONS RATES. The Secretary shall annually publish a table that sets forth the greenhouse gas emissions rates for types or categories of facilities, which a taxpayer shall use for purposes of this section.
Keywords: publishing, emissions, rates, secretary, annually, publish, table, sets, forth, greenhouse, gas, types, categories, facilities, taxpayer, purposes

Text: PROVISIONAL EMISSIONS RATE. In the case of any facility for which an emissions rate has not been established by the Secretary, a taxpayer which owns such facility may file a petition with the Secretary for determination of the emissions rate with respect to such facility.
Keywords: provisional, emissions, rate, case, facility, established, secretary, taxpayer, owns, file, petition, determination, respect

Text: CARBON CAPTURE AND SEQUESTRATION EQUIPMENT. For purposes of this subsection, the amount of greenhouse gases emitted into the atmosphere by a facility in the production of electricity shall not include any qualified carbon dioxide that is captured by the taxpayer and
Keywords: carbon, capture, sequestration, equipment, purposes, subsection, amount, greenhouse, gases, emitted, atmosphere, facility, production, electricity, qualified, dioxide, captured, taxpayer

Keywords: pursuant, regulations, established, 45q, disposed, taxpayer, secure, geological, storage

Text: INFLATION ADJUSTMENT.
Keywords: inflation, adjustment

Text: IN GENERAL. In the case of a calendar year beginning after 2024, the 0.3 cent amount in paragraph (2)(A) of subsection (a) and the 1.5 cent amount in paragraph (2)(B) of such subsection shall each be adjusted by multiplying such amount by the inflation adjustment factor for the calendar year in which the sale, consumption, or storage of the electricity occurs. If the 0.3 cent amount as increased under this paragraph is not a multiple of 0.05 cent, such amount shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of 0.05 cent. If the 1.5 cent amount as increased under this paragraph is not a multiple of 0.1 cent, such amount shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of 0.1 cent.
Keywords: case, calendar, beginning, cent, amount, subsection, adjusted, multiplying, inflation, adjustment, factor, sale, consumption, storage, electricity, occurs, increased, multiple, rounded, nearest

Text: ANNUAL COMPUTATION. The Secretary shall, not later than April 1 of each calendar year, determine and publish in the Federal Register the inflation adjustment factor for such calendar year in accordance with this subsection.
Keywords: annual, computation, secretary, april, calendar, determine, publish, federal, register, inflation, adjustment, factor, accordance, subsection

Text: INFLATION ADJUSTMENT FACTOR. The term ‘inflation adjustment factor’ means, with respect to a calendar year, a fraction the numerator of which is the GDP implicit price deflator for the preceding calendar year and the denominator of which is the GDP implicit price deflator for the calendar year 1992. The term ‘GDP implicit price deflator’ means the most recent revision of the implicit price deflator for the gross domestic product as computed and published by the Department of Commerce before March 15 of the calendar year.
Keywords: inflation, adjustment, factor, term, respect, calendar, fraction, numerator, gdp, implicit, price, deflator, preceding, denominator, revision, gross, domestic, product, computed, published, department, commerce, march

Keywords: definitions, purposes

Text: CO2e PER KWh. The term ‘CO2e per KWh’ means, with respect to any greenhouse gas, the equivalent carbon dioxide (as determined based on global warming potential) per kilowatt hour of electricity produced.

Text: PRODUCTION ATTRIBUTABLE TO THE TAXPAYER. Text: RELATED PERSONS. Persons shall be treated as related to each other if such persons would be treated as a single employer under the regulations prescribed under section 52(b). In the case of a corporation which is a member of an affiliated group of corporations filing a consolidated return, such corporation shall be treated as selling electricity to an unrelated person if such electricity is sold to such a person by another member of such group.

Text: IN GENERAL. Text: ELIGIBLE COOPERATIVE DEFINED. For purposes of this section, the term ‘eligible cooperative’ means a cooperative organization described in section 1381(a) which is owned more than 50 percent by agricultural producers or by entities owned by agricultural producers. Text: ALLOCATIONS.
Keywords: allocations

Text: IN GENERAL. Not later than January 1, 2025, the Secretary shall establish a program to allocate amounts of environmental justice capacity limitation to applicable facilities. In establishing such program and to carry out the purposes of this subsection, the Secretary shall provide procedures to allow for an efficient allocation process, including, when determined appropriate, consideration of multiple projects in a single application if such projects will be placed in service by a single taxpayer.
Keywords: january, secretary, establish, program, allocate, amounts, environmental, justice, capacity, limitation, applicable, facilities, establishing, carry, purposes, subsection, procedures, allow, efficient, allocation, process, determined, appropriate, consideration, multiple, projects, application, placed, service, taxpayer

Text: LIMITATION. The amount of environmental justice capacity limitation allocated by the Secretary under subparagraph (A) during any calendar year shall not exceed the annual capacity limitation with respect to such year.
Keywords: limitation, amount, environmental, justice, capacity, allocated, secretary, subparagraph, calendar, exceed, annual, respect

Text: ANNUAL CAPACITY LIMITATION. For purposes of this paragraph, the term ‘annual capacity limitation’ means 1.8 gigawatts of direct current capacity for each calendar year during the period beginning on January 1, 2025, and ending on December 31 of the applicable year (as defined in section 45Y(d)(3)), and zero thereafter.
Keywords: annual, capacity, limitation, purposes, term, gigawatts, direct, calendar, period, beginning, january, ending, december, applicable, defined, 45y, zero, thereafter

Text: CARRYOVER OF UNUSED LIMITATION.
Keywords: carryover, unused, limitation

Text: IN GENERAL. If the annual capacity limitation for any calendar year exceeds the aggregate amount allocated for such year under this paragraph, such limitation for the succeeding calendar year shall be increased by the amount of such excess. No amount may be carried under the preceding sentence to any calendar year after the third calendar year following the applicable year (as defined in section 45Y(d)(3)).
Keywords: annual, capacity, limitation, calendar, exceeds, aggregate, amount, allocated, succeeding, increased, excess, carried, preceding, sentence, applicable, defined, 45y

Text: CARRYOVER FROM SECTION 48 FOR CALENDAR YEAR 2025. If the annual capacity limitation for calendar year 2024 under section 48(e)(4)(D) exceeds the aggregate amount allocated for such year under such section, such excess amount may be carried over and applied to the annual capacity limitation under this subsection for calendar year 2025. The annual capacity limitation for calendar year 2025 shall be increased by the amount of such excess.
Keywords: carryover, calendar, annual, capacity, limitation, exceeds, aggregate, amount, allocated, excess, carried, applied, subsection, increased

Text: PLACED IN SERVICE DEADLINE.
Keywords: placed, service, deadline

Text: IN GENERAL. Paragraph (1) shall not apply with respect to any property which is placed in service after the date that is 4 years after the date of the allocation with respect to the facility of which such property is a part.
Keywords: apply, respect, property, placed, service, years, allocation, facility

Text: APPLICATION OF CARRYOVER. Any amount of environmental justice capacity limitation which expires under clause (i)  during any calendar year shall be taken into account as an excess described in subparagraph (D)(i) (or as an increase in such excess) for such calendar year, subject to the limitation imposed by the last sentence of such subparagraph.
Keywords: application, carryover, amount, environmental, justice, capacity, limitation, expires, clause

Text: RECAPTURE. The Secretary shall, by regulations or other guidance, provide for recapturing the benefit of any increase in the credit allowed under subsection (a) by reason of this subsection with respect to any property which ceases to be property eligible for such increase (but which does not cease to be investment credit property within the meaning of section 50(a)). The period and percentage of such recapture shall be determined under rules similar to the rules of section 50(a). To the extent provided by the Secretary, such recapture may not apply with respect to any property if, within 12 months after the date the taxpayer becomes aware (or reasonably should have become aware) of such property ceasing to be property eligible for such increase, the eligibility of such property for such increase is restored. The preceding sentence shall not apply more than once with respect to any facility.
Keywords: recapture, secretary, regulations, guidance, recapturing, benefit, increase, credit, allowed, subsection, reason, respect, property, ceases, eligible, cease, investment, meaning, period, percentage, determined, rules, extent, apply, months, taxpayer, becomes, aware, reasonably, ceasing, eligibility, restored, preceding, sentence, facility

Text: IN GENERAL. Subject to clauses (ii)  and (iii), the Secretary shall annually publish a table which sets forth the emissions rate for similar types and categories of transportation fuels based on the amount of lifecycle greenhouse gas emissions (as described in section 211(o)(1)(H) of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7545(o)(1)(H)), as in effect on the date of the enactment of this section) for such fuels, expressed as kilograms of CO2e per mmBTU, which a taxpayer shall use for purposes of this section.
Keywords: subject, clauses

Text: NON-AVIATION FUEL. In the case of any transportation fuel which is not a sustainable aviation fuel, the lifecycle greenhouse gas emissions of such fuel shall be based on the most recent determinations under the Greenhouse gases, Regulated Emissions, and Energy use in Transportation model developed by Argonne National Laboratory, or a successor model (as determined by the Secretary).
Keywords: aviation, fuel, case, transportation, sustainable, lifecycle, greenhouse, gas, emissions, determinations, gases, regulated, energy, model, developed, argonne, national, laboratory, successor, determined, secretary

Keywords: inflation, adjustment

Text: IN GENERAL. In the case of calendar years beginning after 2024, the 20 cent amount in subsection (a)(2)(A), the $1.00 amount in subsection (a)(2)(B), the 35 cent amount in subsection (a)(3)(A)(i), and the $1.75 amount in subsection (a)(3)(A)(ii) shall each be adjusted by multiplying such amount by the inflation adjustment factor for the calendar year in which the sale of the transportation fuel occurs. If any amount as increased under the preceding sentence is not a multiple of 1 cent, such amount shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of 1 cent.
Keywords: case, calendar, years, beginning, cent, amount, subsection

Text: INFLATION ADJUSTMENT FACTOR. Text: PRODUCTION ATTRIBUTABLE TO THE TAXPAYER. Text: RELATED PERSONS. Persons shall be treated as related to each other if such persons would be treated as a single employer under the regulations prescribed under section 52(b). Text: APPROPRIATION. Notwithstanding subsections (a) through (e) and (g), in addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated to the Secretary for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $9,700,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2031, for the long-term resiliency, reliability, and affordability of rural electric systems by providing to an eligible entity (defined as an electric cooperative described in section 501(c)(12) or 1381(a)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and is or has been a Rural Utilities Service electric loan borrower pursuant to the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 or serving a predominantly rural area or a wholly or jointly owned subsidiary of such electric cooperative) loans, modifications of loans, the cost of loans and modifications, and other financial assistance to achieve the greatest reduction in carbon dioxide, methane, and nitrous oxide emissions associated with rural electric systems through the purchase of renewable energy, renewable energy systems, zero-emission systems, and carbon capture and storage systems, to deploy such systems, or to make energy efficiency improvements to electric generation and transmission systems of the eligible entity after the date of enactment of this subsection.

Text: FARM LOAN IMMEDIATE RELIEF FOR BORROWERS WITH AT-RISK AGRICULTURAL OPERATIONS. Text: RESEARCH, EDUCATION, AND EXTENSION. Text: ECOLOGICAL INTEGRITY. The term ‘‘ecological integrity’’ has the meaning given the term in section 219.19 of title 36, Code of Federal Regulations (as in effect on the date of enactment of this Act).
Keywords: ecological, integrity, term, meaning, code, federal, regulations, effect, enactment, act

Text: HAZARDOUS FUELS REDUCTION PROJECT. The term ‘‘hazardous fuels reduction project’’ means an activity, including the use of prescribed fire, to protect structures and communities from wildfire that is carried out on National Forest System land.
Keywords: hazardous, fuels, reduction, project, term, activity, prescribed, fire, protect, structures, communities, wildfire, carried, national, forest, system, land

Text: RESTORATION. The term ‘‘restoration’’ has the meaning given the term in section 219.19 of title 36, Code of Federal Regulations (as in effect on the date of enactment of this Act).
Keywords: restoration, term, meaning, code, federal, regulations, effect, enactment, act

Text: VEGETATION MANAGEMENT PROJECT. The term ‘‘vegetation management project’’ means an activity carried out on National Forest System land to enhance the ecological integrity and achieve the restoration of a forest ecosystem through the removal of vegetation, the use of prescribed fire, the restoration of aquatic habitat, or the decommissioning of an unauthorized, temporary, or system road.
Keywords: vegetation, management, project, term, activity, carried, national, forest, system, land, enhance, ecological, integrity, achieve, restoration, ecosystem, removal, prescribed, fire, aquatic, habitat, decommissioning, unauthorized, temporary, road

Text: LIFECYCLE GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS. Text: PROHIBITION ON COMBINING REBATES. A rebate provided by a State energy office under a HOMES rebate program may not be combined with any other Federal grant or rebate, including a rebate provided under a high-efficiency electric home rebate program (as defined in section 50122(d)), for the same single upgrade.

Keywords: definitions

Text: DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITY. The term ‘‘disadvantaged community’’ means a community that the Secretary determines, based on appropriate data, indices, and screening tools, is economically, socially, or environmentally disadvantaged.
Keywords: disadvantaged, community, term, secretary, determines, appropriate, data, indices, screening, tools, economically, socially, environmentally

Text: HOMES REBATE PROGRAM. The term ‘‘HOMES rebate program’’ means a Home Owner Managing Energy Savings rebate program established by a State energy office as part of an approved State energy conservation plan under the State Energy Program.
Keywords: homes, rebate, program, term, owner, managing, energy, savings, established, state, office, approved, conservation, plan

Text: LOW- OR MODERATE-INCOME HOUSEHOLD. The term ‘‘low- or moderate-income household’’ means an individual or family the total annual income of which is less than 80 percent of the median income of the area in which the individual or family resides, as reported by the Department of Housing and Urban Development, including an individual or family that has demonstrated eligibility for another Federal program with income restrictions equal to or below 80 percent of area median income.
Keywords: moderate, income, household, term, individual, family, total, annual, median, area, resides, reported, department, housing, urban, development, demonstrated, eligibility, federal, program, restrictions, equal

Text: USE OF FUNDS.
Keywords: funds

Text: IN GENERAL. The Secretary may make a grant under this section to a siting authority for, with respect to a covered transmission project, any of the following activities:
Keywords: secretary, grant, siting, authority, respect, covered, transmission, project, activities

Text: Studies and analyses of the impacts of the covered transmission project.
Keywords: studies, analyses, impacts, covered, transmission, project

Text: Examination of up to 3 alternate siting corridors within which the covered transmission project feasibly could be sited.
Keywords: examination, alternate, siting, corridors, covered, transmission, project, feasibly, sited

Text: Participation by the siting authority in regulatory proceedings or negotiations in another jurisdiction, or under the auspices of a Transmission Organization (as defined in section 3 of the Federal Power Act (16 U.S.C. 796)) that is also considering the siting or permitting of the covered transmission project.
Keywords: participation, siting, authority, regulatory, proceedings, negotiations, jurisdiction, auspices, transmission, organization, defined, federal, power, act, u.s.c, considering, permitting, covered, project

Text: Participation by the siting authority in regulatory proceedings at the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission or a State regulatory commission for determining applicable rates and cost allocation for the covered transmission project.
Keywords: participation, siting, authority, regulatory, proceedings, federal, energy, commission, state, determining, applicable, rates, cost, allocation, covered, transmission, project

Text: Other measures and actions that may improve the chances of, and shorten the time required for, approval by the siting authority of the application relating to the siting or permitting of the covered transmission project, as the Secretary determines appropriate.
Keywords: measures, actions, improve, chances, shorten, required, approval, siting, authority, application, relating, permitting, covered, transmission, project, secretary, determines, appropriate

Text: ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT. The Secretary may make a grant under this section to a siting authority, or other State, local, or Tribal governmental entity, for economic development activities for communities that may be affected by the construction and operation of a covered transmission project, provided that the Secretary shall not enter into any grant agreement pursuant to this section that could result in any outlays after September 30, 2031.
Keywords: economic, development, secretary, grant, siting, authority, state, local, tribal, governmental, entity, activities, communities, affected, construction, operation, covered, transmission, project, agreement, pursuant, outlays, september

Text: CONDITIONS.
Keywords: conditions

Text: FINAL DECISION ON APPLICATION. In order to receive a grant for an activity described in subsection (b)(1), the Secretary shall require a siting authority to agree, in writing, to reach a final decision on the application relating to the siting or permitting of the applicable covered transmission project not later than 2 years after the date on which such grant is provided, unless the Secretary authorizes an extension for good cause.
Keywords: final, decision, application, order, grant, activity, described, subsection, secretary, require, siting, authority, agree, writing, reach, relating, permitting, applicable, covered, transmission, project, years, unless, authorizes, extension, cause

Text: FEDERAL SHARE. The Federal share of the cost of an activity described in subparagraph (C) or (D)  of subsection (b)(1) shall not exceed 50 percent.
Keywords: federal, cost, activity, described, subparagraph

Text: ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT. The Secretary may only disburse grant funds for economic development activities under subsection (b)(2)
Keywords: economic, development, secretary, disburse, grant, funds, activities, subsection

Text: to a siting authority upon approval by the siting authority of the applicable covered transmission project; and
Keywords: siting, authority, approval, applicable, covered, transmission, project

Text: to any other State, local, or Tribal governmental entity upon commencement of construction of the applicable covered transmission project in the area under the jurisdiction of the entity.
Keywords: state, local, tribal, governmental, entity, commencement, construction, applicable, covered, transmission, project, area, jurisdiction

Text: DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY. Text: REPORTING. Text: ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS. Of the funds made available under paragraph (2), the Administrator shall reserve 3 percent for administrative costs necessary to carry out this section, to provide technical assistance to eligible entities, to develop a plan that could be used as a model by grantees in developing a plan under subsection (b), and to model the effects of plans described in this section.

Text: GREENHOUSE GAS AIR POLLUTION PLANNING GRANTS. The Administrator shall make a grant to at least one eligible entity in each State for the costs of developing a plan for the reduction of greenhouse gas air pollution to be submitted with an application for a grant under subsection (c). Each such plan shall include programs, policies, measures, and projects that will achieve or facilitate the reduction of greenhouse gas air pollution. Not later than 270 days after the date of enactment of this section, the Administrator shall publish a funding opportunity announcement for grants under this subsection.

Text: FEDERAL HIGHWAY ADMINISTRATION APPROPRIATION. In addition to amounts otherwise available, there is appropriated for fiscal year 2022, out of any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, $2,000,000,000, to remain available until September 30, 2026, to the Administrator to reimburse or provide incentives to eligible recipients for the use, in projects, of construction materials and products that have substantially lower levels of embodied greenhouse gas emissions associated with all relevant stages of production, use, and disposal as compared to estimated industry averages of similar materials or products, as determined by the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, and for the operations and administration of the Federal Highway Administration to carry out this section.
Keywords: federal, highway, administration, appropriation, addition, amounts, otherwise, available, appropriated, fiscal, money, treasury, 2,000,000,000, remain, september, administrator, reimburse, incentives, eligible, recipients, projects, construction, materials, products, substantially, lower, levels, embodied, greenhouse, gas, emissions, associated, relevant, stages, production, disposal, compared, estimated, industry, averages, determined, environmental, protection, agency, operations, carry

Text: REIMBURSEMENT OF INCREMENTAL COSTS; INCENTIVES.
Keywords: reimbursement, incremental, costs, incentives

Text: IN GENERAL. The Administrator shall, subject to the availability of funds, either reimburse or provide incentives to eligible recipients that use low-embodied carbon construction materials and products on a project funded under this title.
Keywords: administrator, subject, availability, funds, reimburse, incentives, eligible, recipients, embodied, carbon, construction, materials, products, project, funded

Text: REIMBURSEMENT AND INCENTIVE AMOUNTS.
Keywords: reimbursement, incentive, amounts

Text: INCREMENTAL AMOUNT. The amount of reimbursement under paragraph (1) shall be equal to the incrementally higher cost of using such materials relative to the cost of using traditional materials, as determined by the eligible recipient and verified by the Administrator.
Keywords: incremental, amount, reimbursement, equal, incrementally, cost, materials, relative, traditional, determined, eligible, recipient, verified, administrator

Text: INCENTIVE AMOUNT. The amount of an incentive under paragraph (1) shall be equal to 2 percent of the cost of using low-embodied carbon construction materials and products on a project funded under this title.
Keywords: incentive, amount, equal, cost, embodied, carbon, construction, materials, products, project, funded

Text: FEDERAL SHARE. If a reimbursement or incentive is provided under paragraph (1), the total Federal share payable for the project for which the reimbursement or incentive is provided shall be up to 100 percent.
Keywords: federal, reimbursement, incentive, total, payable, project
